channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The agriculture secretary says SNAP changes are coming. Here's what we know
item.description: Brooke Rollins has made a case for sweeping changes to food aid programs by claiming USDA has uncovered "massive fraud." But she and USDA haven't prov...

item.title: From ChatGPT to strength training: Here's how 100-year-olds are thriving
item.description: A new survey of centenarians finds a growing number of people living to 100 have prioritized healthy habits. Here's how exercise, social connection an...

item.title: An independent effort says AI is the secret to topple 2-party power in Congress
item.description: Using artificial intelligence to identify congressional districts where independent candidates could win, an organization called the Independent Cente...

item.title: Supreme Court weighs copyright fight between music industry and internet providers
item.description: At issue is whether internet providers can be liable for their users' committing copyright violations using its services.

item.title: During Advent, immigrant congregations find hope shadowed by fear
item.description: The weeks leading up to Christmas are typically a time of anticipation and preparation for Christians, but for some immigrant congregations the mood t...

item.title: Investigators urge witnesses of the deadly shooting at a child’s party in California to come forward
item.description: Authorities are urging witnesses of a deadly shooting at a child’s birthday party in Stockton, California, to come forward as they continue to search ...

item.title: Honduras election on a knife edge as Trump-backed man slightly ahead
item.description: The US president is threatening to cut aid to Honduras if his favoured right-wing presidential candidate does not win.

item.title: Accused fentanyl kingpin wanted by U.S. killed by Mexican military
item.description: Pedro Inzunza Coronel, alias "Pichon," was wanted by the U.S. on accusations of trafficking large amounts of fentanyl and cocaine.

item.title: 11/30/2025: Polymarket; CRISPR Kids; Lamine Yamal
item.description: First, Polymarket lets you bet on almost anything. Then, a look at teens' innovative Lyme disease research. And, Lamine Yamal: The 60 Minutes Intervie...

item.title: UK MP Tulip Siddiq given jail sentence in Bangladesh after trial in her absence
item.description: The former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted former leader, who received a two-year sentence, says the charges are politically motivated.

item.title: China tries to stifle anger over Hong Kong apartment fire as deaths mount
item.description: As the death toll in the Hong Kong apartment complex fire tops 150, Chinese authorities seek to stifle criticism amid new revelations of safety violat...

item.title: Wolves kill 9 people, mostly children, in separate attacks in India
item.description: The latest victim was a 10-month-old girl who was snatched by a wolf while she was sleeping beside her mother, officials said.

item.title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 500
item.description: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured, after a cyclone hit the region.

item.title: US lawmakers demand answers over Hegseth Venezuela boat strike claims
item.description: Concern over media reports that the US military carried out a second strike killing survivors on a suspected drug boat prompts a bipartisan inquiry.

item.title: Japanese 'One Piece' singer stopped mid-show after China-Japan feud
item.description: The sudden cancellation of Japanese events in Shanghai have sparked criticism and fanned nationalist sentiment.

item.title: Trump invites families of 2 National Guard members who were shot to visit the White House
Suspect in National Guard attack struggled with ‘dark isolation’ as community raised concerns
